name: jurisprudential

connected with the study of law and the principles on which law is based: Canada has a jurisprudential tradition of protecting human rights. It is necessary to review the jurisprudential debate among legal scholars. See
jurisprudence
More examplesFewer examplesJurisprudential theory is usually divided into two major modes of analysis.There are many references to his jurisprudential decisions in medieval literature.He has a reputation as an excellent jurisprudential mind.
